text: nottingham was the highest ranking uk university in qs 's new student view category , based on ratings from students and recent graduates .

documents.title: 'all professionals involved should have met to discuss shanay '
text: it is thought at least 10 safeguarding referrals about shanay walker were made .
dr emma fillmore , a consultant paediatrician told the court she had no contact with the seven-year-old but gave an overview of the case .
she said , given the evidence of her injuries , all the professionals involved should have met to discuss it and that such a meeting would happen now .
the coroner said : `` communication channels failed miserably between the school , local authority and health professionals . ''
the inquest continues .
author: Simon Ward
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: shanay walker inquest : information 'withheld from council '
text: a coroner has said communication between professionals `` failed miserably '' before the death of a seven-year-old girl from nottingham .
shanay walker died with more than 50 injuries in july 2014 .
her aunt and grandmother are serving prison sentences for cruelty .
at an inquest in nottingham , coroner mairin casey said : `` there is evidence that information was withheld from the local authority in the months before she died . ''
author: Simon Ward
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: your questions : why are there columns on market square buildings ?
text: terry bartlam used your questions to ask : `` why are most of the buildings on long row , in nottingham 's market square , supported on columns ? ''
it 's a great question that takes us back to the medieval origins of the market place , according to frank earp from nottingham hidden history team .
back then , as now , there were strict laws restricting building in the market square , mr earp said .
eager to expand their businesses , stallholders got round this by building their timber stalls upwards - supporting the larger , overhanging upper storeys with wooden struts .
by victorian times , these structures had been replaced with brick buildings and the wooden struts became the stone columns we see today , creating a colonnade shoppers can walk under .
for more of nottingham in times gone by , visit picture the past 's website .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

research reveals more than a quarter of those loans in nottinghamshire were in ashfield and the least popular area was broxtowe .

documents.title: police working to increase hate crime reports
text: on the hate crime story , nottinghamshire 's police and crime commissioner paddy tipping said they have been trying to get more people to report it .
`` we are keen to get reporting levels up so we are doing a lot across the county , '' he said .
mr tipping said a lot of the reports they had received were race hate crimes from the polish and eastern european communities , as well as religious hate crime from people of muslim background .
`` we need to send a strong message that we wo n't tolerate this kind of behaviour in nottinghamshire , '' he added .
`` it is unacceptable . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'caution needed with hate crime figures '
text: there 's no doubt there was a spike after the brexit vote , but the long-term wo n't become clear for months .
and if 2016 turns out to be a record year , there still needs to be some caution about what the figures mean - .
because of the complicated way hate crimes are counted .
sexual offences rose in recent years thanks to more people coming forward to report what had happened .
if there is a long-term rise in hate crime recorded by police , it may simply reflect that victims have more confidence that it is worth speaking to the police .
author: Dominic Casciani
Home Affairs Correspondent

text: dr ghaharian 's patients have to find a new practice by the end of the month after the local clinical commissioning group decided not to replace the gp at the centre .
